commodity.name: Protobionts
commodity.description: Abiotically produced organic molecules. May have a simple cell-like membrane structure, and be capable of simple self-replication.

commodity.name: Prokaryotes
commodity.description: Simple organisms which lack a cell nucleus, though may have a simple cell structure. They are the simplest living things, evolved from protobionts.

commodity.name: Cyanobacteria
commodity.description: A phylum of bacteria also known as blue-green algae that uses photosynthesis to generate oxygen. They have simple cell structures and are often precursors to true algae.

commodity.name: Algae
commodity.description: Multicellular eukaryotic life, ranging from simple clusters of cells to huge kelp forests. Found in the seas of most life bearing worlds. Also known as seaweed.

commodity.name: Cnidarians
commodity.description: Simple sea creatures such as jellies, sea ameneonies and hydras.

commodity.name: Echinoderms
commodity.description: Bony sea creatures such as starfish.
